page.title: 03ECOLOGY-- SAND DUNES
page.content: This is a seaside area. At the west end of the area the sand dunes rise to about 20 metres high. Marram grass has been planted to stabilise the sand. Sea buckthorn too is spreading especially on the landward side. At first sight there seems little else in the way of plants, but on searching we found puff balls and other fungi, ragwort, sea rocket, willow herb, evening primrose,common storksbill ,ladies bedstraw, plantain,thistles and dandelion. Bushes included tamarisk,hawthorn, blackthorn and elder. Two blockhouses, a legacy of the last war, had deadly nightshade and bindweed around them. The dunes are home to large numbers of rabbits, foxes roam over them, and in the spring cuckoos arrive and thrive on the larvae of the brown tailed moth.
